May 1st, 1880. Catalogues of the students attending the early sessions have never before been published. James F. Harrison, Chairman.
BOARD OF VISITORS. JAMES MADISON, Rector. JAMES MADISON, CHAPMAN JOHNSON, JOSEPH C. CABELL, JAMES BRECKENRIDGE, JOHN H. COCKE, JAMES MONROE. THOMAS JEFF. RANDOLPH. Secretary of the Board, FRANK CARR.

FACULTY AND OFFICERS. ROBERT M. PATTERSON, Chairman of the Faculty. GESSNER HARRISON, Professor of Ancient Languages. GEO. BLÆTTERMANN, Professor of Modern Languages. CHARLES BONNYCASTLE, Professor of Mathematics. ROBERT M. PATTERSON, Professor of Natural Philosophy. JOHN P. EMMET, Professor of Chemistry and Mat. Med. GEORGE TUCKER, Professor of Moral Philosophy. ROBLEY DUNGLISON, Professor of Physiology, Medicine, Obstetrics and Medical Jurisprudence. JOHN A. G. DAVIS, Professor of Law. THOMAS JOHNSON, Demonstrator of Anatomy and Surgery. WILLIAM WERTENBAKER, Librarian and Secretary of the Faculty. ARTHUR S. BROCKENBROUGH, Proctor. ALEXANDER GARRETT, Bursar. Chaplain.

CATALOGUE OF STUDENTS. SEVENTH SESSION.—1830-1831. ABBREVIATIONS. A. L.—Ancient Languages. M. L.—Modern Languages. M.—Mathematics. N. P.—Natural Philosophy. C.—Chemistry. M. P.—Moral Philosophy. MED.—Medicine. A. & S.—Anatomy & Surgery. NAMES. RESIDENCES. SCHOOLS ATTENDED. SES. Alston, Wm. Ashe Georgetown, S. C. M P, LAW, 1 Barclay, David Richmond, Va. A L, M L, M, 2 Baylor, Robert W.
